snippet: The Federal Housing Administration has more than 700,000 seriously delinquent mortgages, and rules limit how deeply those loans can be modified as long as they are backed by the agency.
abstract: Federal Housing Administration announces that it will sell off distressed mortgages in bulk; move is intended to prevent foreclosures for thousands of homeowners and shed some of the agency's 700,000 seriously delinquent home loans.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Housing Administration has more than 700,000 seriously delinquent mortgages, and rules limit how deeply those loans can be modified as long as they are backed by the agency.

headline.seo: To Stem Foreclosures, Federal Housing Agency to Sell Off Loans
headline.main: U.S. Agency to Sell Off Loans to Stem Foreclosures
headline.print_headline: U.S. Agency to Sell Off Loans to Stem Foreclosures
